examples.question:
In the novel "Article 22 Military Regulations" of the American writer Joseph Heller, Article 22 Military Regulations stipulates that only when a soldier's mental status is abnormal and he applies for suspension of flight, can he be allowed to stop flying.According to common sense, if a soldier is aware of the danger of flying and submits an application to stop flying, it shows that his mind is clear and his spirit cannot be abnormal.

Which of the following statements is the logical inference above?

(A)If a person is mentally abnormal, he will be allowed to stop flying.
(B)No one can be allowed to stop flying.
(C)If a person can realize that there is a danger of flying, it shows that he is mentally normal.
(D)If a person can file an application to stop flying, it shows that his spirit cannot be abnormal.

response_pairs.cot_response:
First, let's analyze the given information. According to Article 22 Military Regulations, a soldier can only be allowed to stop flying if their mental status is abnormal and they apply for suspension of flight. 

The statement in question is: "According to common sense, if a soldier is aware of the danger of flying and submits an application to stop flying, it shows that his mind is clear and his spirit cannot be abnormal."

To determine the logical inference, we need to evaluate the relationship between the given information and the statement. 

The given information states that a soldier can only stop flying if their mental status is abnormal and they apply for suspension of flight. 

The statement suggests that if a soldier is aware of the danger of flying and applies to stop flying, it means their mind is clear and their spirit cannot be abnormal. 

Based on this analysis, we can infer that the logical inference is:

(C) If a person can realize that there is a danger of flying, it shows that he is mentally normal.

examples.question:
In the 1940s, more than 7,000 books were published in the United States, of which only over 10 became bestsellers.A New York publisher found that the best-selling book of the year was related to three themes, one related to President Lincoln, one related to doctors, and one related to dogs.He thinks that if these three kinds of content are combined, it will definitely sell well.So he planned to publish the "President of the American President's Physician", and the result of this book was extremely poor.

Which of the following statements best illustrates the shortcomings of the above reasoning?

(A)It is believed that the attributes possessed by the whole are also possessed by the parts.
(B)It is believed that the attributes possessed by parts are also possessed by the whole.
(C)Ignore other possible causes.
(D)Treat the result of a phenomenon as the cause of this phenomenon.

response_pairs.cot_response:
Step 1: Analyze the reasoning presented in the scenario.
The reasoning in the scenario is that because the best-selling book of the year had three themes related to President Lincoln, doctors, and dogs, combining these three themes in a book called "President of the American President's Physician" would definitely sell well.

Step 2: Compare the reasoning to the options provided.
(A) It is believed that the attributes possessed by the whole are also possessed by the parts.
(B) It is believed that the attributes possessed by parts are also possessed by the whole.
(C) Ignore other possible causes.
(D) Treat the result of a phenomenon as the cause of this phenomenon.

Step 3: Determine which statement best illustrates the shortcomings of the reasoning.
The reasoning in the scenario is flawed because it assumes that combining the three themes that were successful individually will automatically lead to success. This flaw can be best illustrated by option (B) - "It is believed that the attributes possessed by parts are also possessed by the whole." This option highlights the error in assuming that the success of individual parts guarantees success when combined.

Therefore, the answer is (B) - "It is believed that the attributes possessed by parts are also possessed by the whole."

examples.question:
Teacher Zhang said? This time, all the students in our class have passed the examination.Therefore, none of the students in our class have passed.

Which of the following is most similar to the above reasoning?

(A)All the students who passed the bottom-up exam passed the review, so all the students who passed the review passed.
(B)All the students who failed the bottom-up exam did not review well, so the students who did not review well did not pass.
(C)All the students who have participated in the bottom-up examination have been carefully prepared.Therefore, the students who have not taken the bottom-up examination have not been carefully prepared.
(D)All heroes can stand the test, so those who cannot stand the test are not heroes.

response_pairs.cot_response:
Sure, let's break it down step by step.

The given statement by Teacher Zhang is: "This time, all the students in our class have passed the examination. Therefore, none of the students in our class have passed."

Now let's analyze each option provided:

(A) "All the students who passed the bottom-up exam passed the review, so all the students who passed the review passed."
This option does not have the same reasoning as the given statement. It talks about students passing different exams and reviews, whereas the given statement is about all students passing the same examination.

(B) "All the students who failed the bottom-up exam did not review well, so the students who did not review well did not pass."
This option also does not have the same reasoning as the given statement. It talks about students failing an exam due to not reviewing well, whereas the given statement is about all students passing the examination.

(C) "All the students who have participated in the bottom-up examination have been carefully prepared. Therefore, the students who have not taken the bottom-up examination have not been carefully prepared."
This option has a similar reasoning pattern to the given statement. It talks about students who have participated in an examination being prepared, and students who have not taken the examination not being prepared. However, the given statement is about all students passing the examination, whereas this option is about students being prepared.

(D) "All heroes can stand the test, so those who cannot stand the test are not heroes."
This option does not have the same reasoning as the given statement. It talks about heroes being able to stand a test, whereas the given statement is about all students passing the examination.

Based on the analysis, option (C) is the most similar in reasoning to the given statement by Teacher Zhang.

examples.question:
A unit arranges for 6 people on duty on the first day, second day, third day of the new year.They are G., H, K, L, P, and S.Two people are required per day.The personnel arrangement must meet the following conditions? (1) L and P must be on duty on the same day.(2) G and H cannot be on duty on the same day.(3) If K is on the first day of duty, then G is on the second day of duty.(4 ) If S is on the third day of duty, then H is on the second day of duty.

Which of the following can be a complete and accurate arrangement of the duty dates of these people?

(A)Junior One? L and P? Junior Two? G and K? Junior Three H and S
(B)First day? L and P? second day? H and K? third day G and S
(C)Junior One? G and K? Junior Two? L and P? Junior Three H and S
(D)Junior One? K and S? Junior Two? G and H? Junior Three L and P

response_pairs.cot_response:
First, let's consider condition (1) - L and P must be on duty on the same day. This means that wherever L is assigned, P must also be assigned to the same day. 

Next, let's consider condition (2) - G and H cannot be on duty on the same day. This means that wherever G is assigned, H cannot be assigned to the same day, and vice versa.

Now, let's consider condition (3) - If K is on the first day of duty, then G is on the second day of duty. This means that if K is assigned to the first day, G must be assigned to the second day.

Lastly, let's consider condition (4) - If S is on the third day of duty, then H is on the second day of duty. This means that if S is assigned to the third day, H must be assigned to the second day.

Based on these conditions, let's analyze each option:

(A) Junior One: L and P, Junior Two: G and K, Junior Three: H and S
This option satisfies condition (1) since L and P are assigned together. However, it violates condition (2) since G and H are assigned together. Therefore, option (A) is not a valid arrangement.

(B) First day: L and P, second day: H and K, third day: G and S
This option satisfies condition (1) since L and P are assigned together. It also satisfies condition (2) since G and H are not assigned together. Additionally, it satisfies condition (3) since K is assigned to the first day and G is assigned to the second day. However, it violates condition (4) since S is assigned to the third day but H is not assigned to the second day. Therefore, option (B) is not a valid arrangement.

(C) Junior One: G and K, Junior Two: L and P, Junior Three: H and S
This option satisfies condition (1) since L and P are assigned together. It also satisfies condition (2) since G and H are not assigned together. Additionally, it satisfies condition (3) since K is assigned to the first day and G is assigned to the second day. It also satisfies condition (4) since S is assigned to the third day and H is assigned to the second day. Therefore, option (C) is a valid arrangement.

(D) Junior One: K and S, Junior Two: G and H, Junior Three

examples.question:
A chemical plant that produces an insecticide that can make small mammals such as otters infertile.After the factory started to operate, the incidence of infertility of an otter living in a nearby river increased rapidly.Therefore, this factory must have polluted the river water when producing pesticides.

Which of the following statements contains the reasoning errors most similar to the ones above?

(A)A low-calcium diet can lead to decreased egg production in poultry.After the chickens on a farm were released for food in spring, their egg production decreased significantly.Therefore, the calcium content of the food they find and ingest must be very low.
(B)The bacteria that cause tetanus survive in the digestive tract of horses.Tetanus is a highly contagious disease.Therefore, horses must be more susceptible to tetanus than most other animals.
(C)Malnourished animals are easily infected with diseases, and animals in big city zoos are not malnourished.Therefore, they are definitely not easily infected.
(D)The ape is characterized by a reversed thumb and no tail.Recently, a fossil remnant of an unknown animal has been discovered.Because this animal has a reversible thumb, it must be an ape.

response_pairs.cot_response:

(A) A low-calcium diet can lead to decreased egg production in poultry. After the chickens on a farm were released for food in spring, their egg production decreased significantly. Therefore, the calcium content of the food they find and ingest must be very low.

This statement contains a similar reasoning error to the given scenario. It assumes that because the chickens' egg production decreased after being released for food, the calcium content of the food they find and ingest must be very low. However, there could be other factors at play that caused the decrease in egg production, such as changes in environment or stress.

(B) The bacteria that cause tetanus survive in the digestive tract of horses. Tetanus is a highly contagious disease. Therefore, horses must be more susceptible to tetanus than most other animals.

This is a reasonable inference based on the information provided.

(C) Malnourished animals are easily infected with diseases, and animals in big city zoos are not malnourished. Therefore, they are definitely not easily infected.

This statement does not contain a similar reasoning error to the given scenario. It makes a logical connection between malnourished animals being easily infected with diseases and animals in big city zoos not being malnourished. This is a reasonable inference based on the information provided.

(D) The ape is characterized by a reversed thumb and no tail. Recently, a fossil remnant of an unknown animal has been discovered. Because this animal has a reversible thumb, it must be an ape.

This statement contains a similar reasoning error to the given scenario. It assumes that because the unknown animal has a reversible thumb, it must be an ape. However, there could be other animals with a reversible thumb that are not apes. This is an example of a hasty generalization based on limited evidence.

Based on the analysis, statement (D) contains reasoning errors most similar to the ones in the given scenario.

examples.question:
The bank's credit card regulations stipulate that all transactions conducted with passwords are deemed to be the actions of the cardholder.This means that as long as the password is used when the credit card is stolen, the bank will regard it as the cardholder's own actions and will not be responsible for the losses incurred.Therefore, in order to make your credit card more secure, you should not set a password.

If the following statement is true, it can weaken the above conclusions, except

(A)Relevant experts believe that it is safer to set a credit card without a password, but the expert's words may not be all right.
(B)When criminals forge credit cards with passwords, they must try to obtain their passwords in order to successfully steal them.
(C)When the credit card is lost, the password of the credit card can effectively prevent others from swiping the card.
(D)In the case of piracy, if the credit card is not set with a password, the court usually determines that the card owner is at fault and must bear no loss.

response_pairs.cot_response:
Sure, let's break it down step by step.

The conclusion is that not setting a password on a credit card makes it more secure. The reasoning behind this conclusion is that if a password is used when the credit card is stolen, the bank will regard it as the cardholder's own actions and will not be responsible for the losses incurred.

Now let's analyze each statement to see if it weakens the conclusion:

(A) Relevant experts believe that it is safer to set a credit card without a password, but the expert's words may not be all right.
This statement does not weaken the conclusion because it suggests that experts believe it is safer to set a password on a credit card.

(B) When criminals forge credit cards with passwords, they must try to obtain their passwords in order to successfully steal them.
This statement weakens the conclusion because it suggests that having a password on a credit card adds an extra layer of security that criminals must overcome in order to successfully steal the card.

(C) When the credit card is lost, the password of the credit card can effectively prevent others from swiping the card.
This statement weakens the conclusion because it suggests that having a password on a credit card can effectively prevent unauthorized use of the card if it is lost.

(D) In the case of piracy, if the credit card is not set with a password, the court usually determines that the card owner is at fault and must bear no loss.
This statement weakens the conclusion because it suggests that if a credit card is not set with a password and is pirated, the card owner may be held responsible for any losses incurred.

Based on the analysis, statement (A) does not weaken the conclusion, but statements (B), (C), and (D) all weaken the conclusion. Therefore, the answer is (A).

examples.question:
Advertisement? "Zhi Lixiao" is a new type of diet pills, which can effectively help fat people lose weight.In clinical trials, only 6 out of 100 people taking Zhilixiao reported side effects.Therefore, 94% of people have a positive effect after taking Zhilixiao, which is the most effective weight loss drug on the market.

Which of the following statements most appropriately points out the problem with the advertisement?

(A)The advertisement depreciates other weight loss pills, but does not provide enough evidence that there is unfair competition.
(B)The advertisement makes a suspicious assumption? if the drug has no side effects, it will have a positive effect on weight loss.
(C)When the advertisement proves the weight loss effect of Zhilixiao, the sample data provided is too small to be representative.
(D)Moving flowers, exaggerating, false propaganda, this is a common problem of all advertisements, and this advertisement is no exception.

response_pairs.cot_response:
Sure, let's break it down step by step.

The advertisement claims that "Zhi Lixiao" is a new type of diet pills that can effectively help fat people lose weight. This is the main claim of the advertisement.

The advertisement then states that in clinical trials, only 6 out of 100 people taking Zhilixiao reported side effects. This is presented as evidence of the safety of the product.

Next, the advertisement concludes that 94% of people have a positive effect after taking Zhilixiao, making it the most effective weight loss drug on the market.

Now, let's evaluate the given statements and identify any potential problems:

(A) The advertisement depreciates other weight loss pills, but does not provide enough evidence that there is unfair competition.
This statement is not directly addressing any problem with the advertisement. It is more about the fairness of competition between weight loss pills, which is not the main concern here.

(B) The advertisement makes a suspicious assumption - if the drug has no side effects, it will have a positive effect on weight loss.
This statement points out a potential problem with the advertisement. The assumption that a lack of side effects automatically translates to a positive effect on weight loss is not supported by evidence. It is possible for a drug to have no side effects but still be ineffective for weight loss.

(C) When the advertisement proves the weight loss effect of Zhilixiao, the sample data provided is too small to be representative.
This statement also highlights a potential problem with the advertisement. The sample size of 100 people in the clinical trials may not be large enough to draw reliable conclusions about the weight loss effect of Zhilixiao. A larger sample size would be more representative and provide more accurate results.

(D) Moving flowers, exaggerating, false propaganda, this is a common problem of all advertisements, and this advertisement is no exception.
This statement is a general criticism of advertisements and does not specifically address any problem with this particular advertisement.

Based on the evaluation, both statement (B) and (C) point out potential problems with the advertisement. However, statement (C) is more directly related to the evidence provided in the advertisement, as it questions the representativeness of the sample data. Therefore, statement (C) most appropriately points out the problem with the advertisement.

examples.question:
twenty two.WiFi transmitters generate electromagnetic radiation.Five Danish middle school students put cress seeds in a room with a WiFi transmitter and without a WiFi transmitter for cultivation.After 12 days, they found that the germination rate of the seeds in the room without a WiFi transmitter was 95.4%, with WiFi transmission The germination rate of seeds in the machine room was 85.3%.Many people worry that WiFi radiation will affect human health.However, many experts believe that the above experiment is not rigorous, and it cannot be concluded that WiFi radiation is harmful to humans.

Which of the following assertions can support the opinions of these experts?

(A)The impact of WiFi radiation on the human body is related not only to its frequency, but also to the distance between the WiFi transmitter and the human body.
(B)Keep other conditions unchanged in the same room, and repeat the experiment with and without a WiFi transmitter.
(C)There are many factors that affect the germination of seeds, and experiments by Danish middle school students cannot exclude the interference of other factors.
(D)Animal experiments should be done to determine the effects of WiFi radiation on the human body, not just plant experiments.

response_pairs.cot_response:

It implies that the experiment may not have accurately reflected the potential impact of WiFi radiation on human health. Therefore, this assertion aligns with the concerns raised by the experts.

(B) Keep other conditions unchanged in the same room, and repeat the experiment with and without a WiFi transmitter.

While this assertion does not directly address the concerns raised by the experts, it does propose a more rigorous experimental design, which could support their opinions.

This assertion highlights the possibility that other factors, besides WiFi radiation, could have influenced the germination rate of the seeds. It suggests that the experiment may not have been able to isolate the effects of WiFi radiation accurately. Therefore, this assertion aligns with the concerns raised by the experts.

(D) Animal experiments should be done to determine the effects of WiFi radiation on the human body, not just plant experiments.

While this assertion does not directly address the concerns raised by the experts regarding the specific experiment conducted by the Danish middle school students, it does raise a valid point about the limitations of plant experiments in this context.

However, assertion (D) is not directly related to the specific experiment but raises a valid point about the limitations of plant experiments in general. examples.question:
After all the cold dishes at the banquet at one table were served, there were 7 hot dishes.Among them, three Sichuan dishes? K, L, M? three Cantonese dishes? Q, N, P? one Shandong dish? X.Only one hot dish can be served at a time, and the order of serving must meet the following conditions? (1) Cannot serve Sichuan cuisine or Cantonese cuisine continuously.(2) Unless the second is on Q, P cannot be on before Q.(3) P must be on before X.(4) M must be on before K, and K must be on before N.

The following lists the order of serving from the first to the seventh, which one meets the conditions?

(A)Q, M, P, L, X, K, N
(B)Q, M, X, P, K, N, L
(C)L, P, M, Q, X, K, N
(D)M, Q, K, L, P, X, N

response_pairs.cot_response:
First, let's consider condition (1) - we cannot serve Sichuan cuisine or Cantonese cuisine continuously. This means that we cannot have two consecutive Sichuan dishes or two consecutive Cantonese dishes.

Next, let's consider condition (2) - unless the second is on Q, P cannot be on before Q. This means that if Q is the second dish, then P cannot be the first dish.

Moving on to condition (3) - P must be on before X. This means that P must be served before X.

Lastly, let's consider condition (4) - M must be on before K, and K must be on before N. This means that M must be served before K, and K must be served before N.

Now, let's analyze the options one by one:

(A) Q, M, P, L, X, K, N
- This option violates condition (2) because P is before Q. Therefore, option (A) is not valid.

(B) Q, M, X, P, K, N, L
- This option satisfies condition (2) because Q is the second dish. It also satisfies condition (3) because P is before X. However, it violates condition (1) because M and K are consecutive Sichuan dishes. Therefore, option (B) is not valid.

(C) L, P, M, Q, X, K, N
- This option satisfies condition (1) because there are no consecutive Sichuan or Cantonese dishes. It satisfies condition (2) because Q is the fourth dish. It satisfies condition (3) because P is before X. It also satisfies condition (4) because M is before K, and K is before N. Therefore, option (C) is a valid order of serving the dishes.

(D) M, Q, K, L, P, X, N
- This option violates condition (3) because P is not before X. Therefore, option (D) is not valid.

Based on the analysis, the correct order of serving the hot dishes at the banquet that satisfies all the given conditions is option (C) - L, P, M, Q, X, K, N.

examples.question:
Those who protect freedom of thought argue that freedom of thought is a prerequisite for intellectual progress.Because freedom of thought allows thinkers to follow their own ideas regardless of who they offend and lead them in.However, a person must dig out sufficient connections related to certain ideas in order to promote intellectual progress.To this end, thinkers need to think about the law.Therefore, the argument about freedom of thought is untenable.

If any of the following statements, can the above conclusion be reached logically?

(A)In societies that protect freedom of thought, thinkers always lack the rules of thinking.
(B)The thinker limits his line of thought to a certain orthodox thought, which will hinder their intellectual progress.
(C)Freedom of thought can trigger creativity, and creativity can help discover truth.
(D)Without the law of thought, thinkers cannot have freedom of thought.

response_pairs.cot_response:
Sure, let's analyze each statement and see if it supports or contradicts the conclusion.

(A) In societies that protect freedom of thought, thinkers always lack the rules of thinking.
This statement suggests that in societies that protect freedom of thought, thinkers do not have any rules or guidelines for their thinking. This does not directly support or contradict the conclusion. It is possible for thinkers to have rules or guidelines for their thinking even in societies that protect freedom of thought. Therefore, this statement does not impact the conclusion.

(B) The thinker limits his line of thought to a certain orthodox thought, which will hinder their intellectual progress.
This statement suggests that if a thinker limits their thinking to a certain orthodox thought, it will hinder their intellectual progress. This supports the conclusion that freedom of thought is necessary for intellectual progress because it implies that without freedom of thought, thinkers may be limited in their thinking and hindered in their intellectual progress.

(C) Freedom of thought can trigger creativity, and creativity can help discover truth.
This statement supports the argument that freedom of thought is necessary for intellectual progress. It suggests that freedom of thought can trigger creativity, which in turn can help in the discovery of truth. This aligns with the idea that freedom of thought allows thinkers to follow their own ideas and promotes intellectual progress.

(D) Without the law of thought, thinkers cannot have freedom of thought.
This statement suggests that without the law of thought, thinkers cannot have freedom of thought. This contradicts the conclusion that the argument about freedom of thought is untenable. If thinkers cannot have freedom of thought without the law of thought, then the argument for freedom of thought being necessary for intellectual progress would still hold.

Based on the analysis of these statements, both statement (B) and statement (C) support the conclusion that freedom of thought is necessary for intellectual progress. Statement (D) contradicts the conclusion, while statement (A) does not have a direct impact on the conclusion. Therefore, the conclusion reached in the given argument is not logically supported by all of the provided statements.

examples.question:
Placebo effect" refers to the phenomenon of letting patients take fake drugs that have no effect at all without knowing it, but they can get the same or better effects than real drugs.The "placebo effect" has been supported by many clinical studies.One explanation for this phenomenon is that human expectations for the future will change the physiological state of the brain, which in turn will cause physiological changes throughout the body.

The following statements can support the above explanation, except

(A)The placebo effect is the result of a combination of factors.
(B)Placebo has no effect on Alzheimer's patients who have lost their expected future abilities.
(C)Some patients do not believe that the treatment will be effective.Although they have been treated normally, their condition has worsened.
(D)Inject the subject with normal saline and make him believe that it is an analgesic.The subject's brain then secretes the analgesic endorphin.

response_pairs.cot_response:
(A) The statement that the placebo effect is the result of a combination of factors supports the explanation for the placebo effect. It suggests that multiple factors, including human expectations, contribute to the physiological changes observed in the placebo effect. Therefore, statement (A) supports the explanation.

(B) The statement that placebo has no effect on Alzheimer's patients who have lost their expected future abilities does not support the explanation for the placebo effect. It suggests that the placebo effect may not occur in certain cases, specifically in patients with Alzheimer's who have lost their expected future abilities. Therefore, statement (B) does not support the explanation.

(C) The statement that some patients do not believe that the treatment will be effective, but their condition has worsened despite being treated normally, supports the explanation for the placebo effect. It suggests that even if patients do not believe in the treatment, their physiological state can still be influenced by their expectations, leading to changes in their condition. Therefore, statement (C) supports the explanation.

(D) The statement that injecting the subject with normal saline and making them believe it is an analgesic causes the brain to secrete the analgesic endorphin supports the explanation for the placebo effect. It suggests that the brain's physiological response, such as the secretion of endorphins, can be influenced by the belief in receiving a treatment, even if the treatment itself is inert. Therefore, statement (D) supports the explanation.

Based on this analysis, the statement that does not support the explanation for the placebo effect is (B) - "Placebo has no effect on Alzheimer's patients who have lost their expected future abilities."

examples.question:
The company sent three young staff members to the South for business trip.The three of them happened to be sitting in a row.At least one of the two people sitting on the right side of 24 years old was 20 years old.20 years old.At least one of the two people sitting on the left of the accountant is a salesperson, and one of the two people sitting on the right of the salesperson is also a salesperson.

So what are the three young people on business?

(A)20-year-old accountant, 20-year-old salesperson, 24-year-old salesperson
(B)20-year-old accountant, 24-year-old salesperson, 24-year-old salesperson
(C)24-year-old accountant, 20-year-old salesperson, 20-year-old salesperson
(D)20-year-old accountant, 20-year-old accountant, 24-year-old salesperson

response_pairs.cot_response:
First, let's consider the condition that at least one of the two people sitting on the right side of the 24-year-old is 20 years old. This means that the 24-year-old cannot be sitting on the rightmost seat, as there would be no one to their right. So, the 24-year-old must be sitting in either the middle or leftmost seat.

Next, let's consider the condition that at least one of the two people sitting on the left of the accountant is a salesperson. Since the 24-year-old cannot be sitting on the rightmost seat, the accountant must be sitting in either the middle or leftmost seat. Therefore, the 24-year-old must be sitting in the middle seat.

Now, let's consider the condition that one of the two people sitting on the right of the salesperson is also a salesperson. Since the 24-year-old is sitting in the middle seat, the salesperson must be sitting in the rightmost seat. This means that the accountant must be sitting in the leftmost seat.

Based on these deductions, we can determine the occupations and ages of the three young staff members:

Leftmost seat: 20-year-old accountant
Middle seat: 24-year-old salesperson
Rightmost seat: 20-year-old salesperson

Therefore, the answer is (A) 20-year-old accountant, 20-year-old salesperson, 24-year-old salesperson.

examples.question:
Cicero in ancient Rome once said? "Elegance and beauty cannot be separated from health." The Italian Renaissance humanitarian Lorenzo Barra emphasized that health is a precious quality and a "natural gift" Is a gift from nature.He wrote? "Many healthy people are not beautiful, but no beautiful person is unhealthy."

The following items can be derived from Loren Barra ’s exposition, except?

(A)No unhealthy person is beautiful.
(B)Some healthy people are beautiful
(C)Some beautiful people are not healthy.
(D)Some people who are not beautiful are healthy.

response_pairs.cot_response:
Sure, let's break it down step by step.

Statement 1: "Elegance and beauty cannot be separated from health."

If the following statement is true, which one would most strongly weaken the above argument?

(A)Chinese students participating in the questionnaire survey may not express their best wishes
(B)If Chinese students in North America cannot find a job when they return home, it will disappoint them
(C)67 ﹪ and 33 ﹪ add up to 100 ﹪, which means zero people want to stay and work in North America
(D)Among the Chinese students in North America, those who do not intend to return to work did not attend the job fair

(D) Among the Chinese students in North America, those who do not intend to return to work did not attend the job fair.
This statement suggests that the survey results may not represent the entire population of Chinese students in North America. If those who do not intend to return to work did not attend the job fair, then the survey results may not accurately reflect the intentions of all Chinese students. However, this statement does not directly challenge the assumption that international students in the US have lost their attraction.

Based on the analysis, statement (C) would most strongly weaken the argument that international students in the US have lost their attraction and returning to China has become a common practice.

examples.question:
To date, the oldest Homo sapiens remains have appeared in Africa, about 200,000 years ago.According to this, many scientists believe that humans originated in Africa, and Homo sapiens, the direct ancestor of modern people, evolved in Africa about 200,000 years ago, and then slowly migrated northwards about 150,000 to 200,000 years ago , Crossing the Middle East to Europe and Asia, and gradually migrating to other parts of the world.

Which of the following, if true, can best refute the views of the above scientists?

(A)Modern Homo sapiens, living in the late Paleolithic period, about 40,000 to 10,000 years ago.There are hundreds of places where late Homo sapiens fossils or cultural sites have been found in our country
(B)In an archaeological excavation in South America, people discovered the fossils of Homo sapiens skulls that lived about 170,000 years ago
(C)Homo sapiens have the extraordinary ability to communicate with each other, make plans, and solve difficult problems
(D)Eight Homo sapiens teeth 400,000 years ago were discovered in the Qesem cave 12 km east of Tel Aviv, Israel

response_pairs.cot_response:
Step 1: Analyze statement (A)
Statement (A) mentions the discovery of late Homo sapiens fossils or cultural sites in our country, which suggests that Homo sapiens existed outside of Africa during the late Paleolithic period. However, it does not directly refute the belief that humans originated in Africa about 200,000 years ago.

Step 2: Analyze statement (B)
Statement (B) states that fossils of Homo sapiens skulls were discovered in South America, dating back to about 170,000 years ago. This contradicts the belief that humans originated in Africa about 200,000 years ago, as it suggests the presence of Homo sapiens in South America before the estimated migration out of Africa.

Step 3: Analyze statement (C)
Statement (C) mentions the extraordinary abilities of Homo sapiens, such as communication, planning, and problem-solving. While this statement highlights the unique characteristics of Homo sapiens, it does not directly refute the belief that humans originated in Africa about 200,000 years ago.

Step 4: Analyze statement (D)
Statement (D) states the discovery of Homo sapiens teeth dating back 400,000 years ago in Israel. This contradicts the belief that humans originated in Africa about 200,000 years ago, as it suggests the presence of Homo sapiens in a different region and at an earlier time.

Step 5: Conclusion
Based on the analysis, statement (B) is the one that can best refute the views of the scientists who believe that humans originated in Africa about 200,000 years ago. The discovery of Homo sapiens fossils in South America dating back to about 170,000 years ago challenges the idea of a single origin in Africa and suggests the possibility of multiple migration events.

examples.question:
As long as there are scammers in this society and some people have greed in their hearts, then someone must be cheated.So if society progresses so that no one is deceived, then people in that society must have universally eliminated greed.

Which of the following best supports the above argument?

(A)The greater the greed, the easier it is to be deceived.
(B)The society has improved, and the scammers will no longer exist.
(C)With the progress of society, the quality of people will generally improve, and greed will gradually be eliminated.
(D)No matter in what society, scammers always exist.

(A) The greater the greed, the easier it is to be deceived.
This statement suggests a correlation between greed and being deceived, but it doesn't directly address the existence of scammers or the possibility of someone being cheated. It doesn't provide strong support for the argument.

(B) The society has improved, and the scammers will no longer exist.

(C) With the progress of society, the quality of people will generally improve, and greed will gradually be eliminated.
This statement directly addresses the argument by suggesting that as society progresses, the quality of people will improve and greed will be eliminated. This supports the idea that if society progresses to the point where no one is deceived, it is because greed has been universally eliminated. This statement provides strong support for the argument.

(D) No matter in what society, scammers always exist.
This statement acknowledges the existence of scammers in any society, but it doesn't directly address the argument that someone will be cheated as long as there are scammers and greed. It doesn't provide strong support for the argument.

Based on this analysis, statement (C) provides the strongest support for the argument.

examples.question:
Based on the following questions? Most people think that advertisers do whatever they can to attract customers.But advertisers are not always like this.Recently, in order to expand sales, a family magazine called "Bay" was renamed "Inferno", which mainly published violent and pornographic content.As a result, some perennial advertisers from the original "Bay" magazine refused to renew the contract and turned to other publications.This shows that these advertisers not only consider economic benefits, but also take into account their ethical responsibilities.

If the following items are true, they can weaken the above argument, except

(A)The violent and pornographic content published in Purgatory magazine is more moderate in similar magazines.
(B)Magazines that publish violent and pornographic content usually sell well, but have low credibility.
(C)The above-mentioned advertisers who refused to renew their contracts mainly promoted household goods.
(D)The advertising cost of the purgatory magazine after the name change is several times higher than before the name change.

response_pairs.cot_response:

(A) The violent and pornographic content published in Purgatory magazine is more moderate in similar magazines.
This statement suggests that the content in "Inferno" is not as extreme as in other similar magazines. If advertisers are aware of this and still refuse to renew their contracts, it would strengthen the argument that they consider ethical responsibilities. Therefore, this statement does not weaken the argument.

(B) Magazines that publish violent and pornographic content usually sell well, but have low credibility.
This statement suggests that magazines with violent and pornographic content may have low credibility. If advertisers are concerned about associating their brands with low credibility publications, it would support the argument that they consider ethical responsibilities. Therefore, this statement does not weaken the argument.

(C) The above-mentioned advertisers who refused to renew their contracts mainly promoted household goods.
This statement suggests that the advertisers who refused to renew their contracts mainly promoted household goods. If these advertisers have a specific target audience that may not align with the violent and pornographic content of "Inferno," it could explain their decision and weaken the argument that they consider ethical responsibilities. Therefore, this statement weakens the argument.

(D) The advertising cost of the purgatory magazine after the name change is several times higher than before the name change.
This statement suggests that the advertising cost of "Inferno" increased significantly after the name change. While this may impact advertisers' decisions, it does not directly address their consideration of ethical responsibilities. Therefore, this statement weakens the argument.

Based on the analysis, the statement that weakens the argument is (C) The above-mentioned advertisers who refused to renew their contracts mainly promoted household goods.

examples.question:
Among the middle school students in a school, medical examinations were conducted for those who drank 2 to 3 bottles of beer every day for 60 days and found that 75% of the students had significantly deteriorated liver function.Experiments with a high degree of confidence have ruled out the possibility that "these results happen to happen".

If the information in the stem is true, which of the following conclusions will be confirmed?

(A)Drinking alcohol causes liver function to deteriorate.
(B)Drinking alcohol has a clear correlation with liver function deterioration in adolescents.
(C)The researchers wanted to prove that young people should not drink alcohol.
(D)Sex has nothing to do with drinking and liver function degradation.

response_pairs.cot_response:
Step 1: Analyze the information provided
According to the information given, medical examinations were conducted on middle school students who drank 2 to 3 bottles of beer every day for 60 days. It was found that 75% of these students had significantly deteriorated liver function. It is also mentioned that experiments with a high degree of confidence have ruled out the possibility that these results happened by chance.

Step 2: Evaluate each conclusion option
(A) Drinking alcohol causes liver function to deteriorate: This conclusion can be supported by the information provided. The fact that 75% of the students who drank alcohol had deteriorated liver function suggests a causal relationship between alcohol consumption and liver function deterioration.

(B) Drinking alcohol has a clear correlation with liver function deterioration in adolescents: This conclusion can also be supported by the information provided. The fact that a significant number of students who drank alcohol experienced liver function deterioration indicates a correlation between alcohol consumption and liver function deterioration.

(C) The researchers wanted to prove that young people should not drink alcohol: This conclusion cannot be confirmed based on the given information. The information does not provide any indication of the researchers' intentions or goals.

(D) Sex has nothing to do with drinking and liver function degradation: The information provided does not mention anything about the relationship between sex and drinking or liver function degradation. Therefore, this conclusion cannot be confirmed based on the given information.

Step 3: Determine the confirmed conclusion
Based on the analysis, both conclusion (A) and (B) can be confirmed based on the given information. The information suggests a causal relationship between alcohol consumption and liver function deterioration, as well as a clear correlation between alcohol consumption and liver function deterioration in adolescents.

examples.question:
Turkey has applied for membership in the EU since 1987, and the two sides are still in difficult negotiations until now.From a strategic perspective, the EU needs Turkey.If you say "no" to Turkey, the EU will lose Turkey's cooperation in security, justice, and energy.However, if Turkey joins the EU, it will bring a series of problems such as inconsistent cultural and religious views, heavy burden of economic subsidies, and a large influx of immigrants into the job market.

Which of the following conclusions can be derived from the above statement?

(A)In the long run, the EU cannot not only obtain Turkey's comprehensive cooperation, but also completely avoid the difficult problems caused by Turkey's accession to the EU.
(B)If Turkey meets the EU's political and economic accession standards, it can join the EU.
(C)The EU will either get full cooperation from Turkey or completely avoid the troubles caused by Turkey's accession to the EU.
(D)Only 3% of Turkey ’s land is in Europe, and most Europeans do not recognize Turkey as a European country.

response_pairs.cot_response:
First, let's analyze the statement provided. It states that Turkey has been applying for EU membership since 1987 and that negotiations are still ongoing. It also mentions that the EU needs Turkey for cooperation in security, justice, and energy. However, it also acknowledges that Turkey's accession to the EU would bring problems such as cultural and religious differences, economic subsidies, and immigration.

Now, let's evaluate each conclusion:

(A) In the long run, the EU cannot only obtain Turkey's comprehensive cooperation but also completely avoid the difficult problems caused by Turkey's accession to the EU.

This conclusion suggests that the EU cannot both obtain Turkey's cooperation and avoid the problems caused by its accession. Based on the information provided, it is clear that Turkey's accession would bring challenges. Therefore, this conclusion is likely to be true.

(B) If Turkey meets the EU's political and economic accession standards, it can join the EU.

This conclusion suggests that if Turkey meets the EU's standards, it can join the EU. While it is true that meeting the EU's standards is a requirement for membership, the statement does not provide information about whether Turkey meets these standards. Therefore, this conclusion cannot be derived from the given statement.

(C) The EU will either get full cooperation from Turkey or completely avoid the troubles caused by Turkey's accession to the EU.

This conclusion suggests that the EU will either get full cooperation from Turkey or avoid the problems caused by its accession. However, the statement does not provide information to support this conclusion. It only mentions that the EU needs Turkey's cooperation and that there would be problems with its accession. Therefore, this conclusion cannot be derived from the given statement.

(D) Only 3% of Turkey's land is in Europe, and most Europeans do not recognize Turkey as a European country.

This conclusion is not relevant to the given statement. While it is true that only a small portion of Turkey's land is in Europe and there may be differing opinions on whether Turkey is a European country, this information does not directly relate to the EU's negotiations with Turkey or the potential benefits and challenges of its accession. Therefore, this conclusion cannot be derived from the given statement.

Based on the analysis, the conclusion that can be derived from the given statement is:

(A) In the long run, the EU cannot only obtain Turkey's comprehensive cooperation but also completely avoid the difficult problems caused by Turkey's accession to the EU.

examples.question:
Companies created through venture capital financing have a lower failure rate than companies created through other channels.It can be seen that, compared with the personal qualities of entrepreneurs, company strategic planning or company management structure, financing channels are more important factors for the successful development of a new company.

If which of the following statements is true, will the above statement be weakened most effectively?

(A)About half of the new companies went bankrupt within 5 years of establishment.
(B)The management structure of startups is usually not as reasonable as that of developing companies.
(C)Compared with other investors, venture capitalists are more sensitive to changes in the financial needs of startups.
(D)When deciding whether to fund startups, venture capitalists must consider the personal qualities of the entrepreneur, the company ’s strategic planning and other factors.

response_pairs.cot_response:
First, let's review the original statement: "Companies created through venture capital financing have a lower failure rate than companies created through other channels. It can be seen that, compared with the personal qualities of entrepreneurs, company strategic planning or company management structure, financing channels are more important factors for the successful development of a new company."

To weaken this statement, we need to find a statement that suggests that factors other than financing channels are more important for the successful development of a new company.

Now, let's analyze each statement:

(A) About half of the new companies went bankrupt within 5 years of establishment.
This statement suggests a high failure rate among new companies, regardless of their financing channels. However, it does not directly address the importance of financing channels compared to other factors. Therefore, it does not weaken the original statement effectively.

(B) The management structure of startups is usually not as reasonable as that of developing companies.
This statement suggests that startups may have less reasonable management structures compared to more established companies. While this may be a factor in the success of a new company, it does not directly address the importance of financing channels. Therefore, it does not weaken the original statement effectively.

(C) Compared with other investors, venture capitalists are more sensitive to changes in the financial needs of startups.
This statement suggests that venture capitalists are more attuned to the financial needs of startups compared to other investors. While this may be a positive aspect of venture capital financing, it does not directly address the importance of financing channels compared to other factors. Therefore, it does not weaken the original statement effectively.

(D) When deciding whether to fund startups, venture capitalists must consider the personal qualities of the entrepreneur, the company's strategic planning, and other factors.
This statement suggests that venture capitalists consider multiple factors, including the personal qualities of the entrepreneur and the company's strategic planning, when deciding whether to fund startups. This implies that financing channels alone may not be the most important factor for the successful development of a new company. Therefore, this statement weakens the original statement most effectively.

Therefore, the correct answer is (D) "When deciding whether to fund startups, venture capitalists must consider the personal qualities of the entrepreneur, the company's strategic planning, and other factors."

examples.question:
There is an authoritative public opinion polling agency that investigates the causes of the terrorist attacks on September 11, and found that 40% of the people believed that they were caused by unfair foreign policy of the United States, and 55% It is believed that it is due to the conflict between Islamic civilization and Western civilization.23% of people believe that it is due to the evil nature of terrorists, and 19% of them did not express their views.

Which of the following best explains the contradictory statement above?

(A)The sampling of the survey sample is not random and therefore not representative.
(B)Some respondents later changed their views.
(C)Many investigators believe that the causes of the "September 11" terrorist attacks were not single but compound.
(D)There are technical errors in the calculation of the investigation results.

response_pairs.cot_response:
Step 1: Analyze the given information
According to the information provided, there are different percentages of people who believe in different causes of the September 11 terrorist attacks. This suggests that there is a contradiction in the opinions of the respondents.

Step 2: Evaluate each option
(A) The sampling of the survey sample is not random and therefore not representative.
This option suggests that the survey sample may not accurately represent the population, leading to contradictory results. However, the information provided does not mention anything about the sampling method used, so it is not a plausible explanation for the contradiction.

(B) Some respondents later changed their views.
This option suggests that some respondents may have initially held one belief but later changed their views, leading to contradictory results. While this is a possibility, there is no information provided to support this explanation.

(C) Many investigators believe that the causes of the "September 11" terrorist attacks were not single but compound.
This option suggests that the causes of the September 11 attacks were not singular but rather a combination of factors. This aligns with the information provided, which shows different percentages of people believing in different causes. Therefore, this is a plausible explanation for the contradiction.

(D) There are technical errors in the calculation of the investigation results.
This option suggests that there may be technical errors in the calculation of the investigation results, leading to contradictory results. However, there is no information provided to suggest any technical errors, so this is not a plausible explanation.

Step 3: Determine the best explanation
Based on the analysis and evaluation of each option, the best explanation for the contradictory statement is option (C) - Many investigators believe that the causes of the "September 11" terrorist attacks were not single but compound. This explanation aligns with the information provided and suggests that the causes of the attacks were multifaceted, leading to different beliefs among the respondents.

examples.question:
In judicial trials, the so-called affirmative misjudgment refers to convicting an innocent person as guilty, referred to as misjudgment? negative misjudgment refers to convicting a guilty person as innocent, referred to as misplacement.The fundamental principle of judicial justice is "to not let a bad person go, not to injustice a good person".A jurist believes that measuring whether a court implements the principles of judicial justice well in handling cases depends on whether its rate of positive misjudgments is low enough.

Which of the following can most strongly support the views of the above jurists?

(A)The accuracy of handling cases in various courts has improved significantly.
(B)The negative misjudgment rate of each court is basically the same.
(C)Wrong judgment rather than misplacement is a reflection of the "left" thinking in the judiciary.
(D)Most of the losses caused by misplacement are remedyable; the damage caused by the misjudgment to the victim is irreparable.

response_pairs.cot_response:
Sure, let's break it down step by step.

The jurists believe that measuring whether a court implements the principles of judicial justice well depends on whether its rate of positive misjudgments is low enough. In other words, they believe that a court should not wrongly convict innocent people.

Now let's evaluate each statement to see which one can most strongly support the jurists' views:

(A) The accuracy of handling cases in various courts has improved significantly.
This statement suggests that courts are becoming more accurate in handling cases. If the accuracy of handling cases has improved significantly, it implies that the rate of positive misjudgments is likely to be lower. This aligns with the jurists' view that a court should not wrongly convict innocent people. Therefore, this statement can support the jurists' views.

(B) The negative misjudgment rate of each court is basically the same.
This statement is about the negative misjudgment rate, which refers to convicting a guilty person as innocent. While it is relevant to the concept of misjudgment, it does not directly address the jurists' concern about wrongly convicting innocent people. Therefore, this statement may not strongly support the jurists' views.

(C) Wrong judgment rather than misplacement is a reflection of the "left" thinking in the judiciary.
This statement introduces a political perspective by suggesting that wrong judgment is a reflection of a specific ideology in the judiciary. While it may be an interesting point, it does not directly support the jurists' views about measuring a court's implementation of judicial justice based on the rate of positive misjudgments.

(D) Most of the losses caused by misplacement are remedyable; the damage caused by the misjudgment to the victim is irreparable.
This statement focuses on the consequences of misplacement and misjudgment. While it acknowledges the damage caused by misjudgment, it does not directly address the jurists' concern about wrongly convicting innocent people. Therefore, this statement may not strongly support the jurists' views.

Based on the analysis, statement (A) - "The accuracy of handling cases in various courts has improved significantly" - can most strongly support the views of the jurists regarding the measurement of a court's implementation of the principles of judicial justice.

examples.question:
Scientists applied desulfurized ash residues from some power plants to 40 acres of saline-alkali land in Inner Mongolia.As a result, corn and grass have grown in this land.The scientists concluded that the desulfurized ash residues from coal-fired power plants can be used to transform saline-alkali land.

Which of the following, if true, best supports the scientist ’s conclusion?

(A)The corn grown in the saline-alkali land improved with desulfurized ash has similar growth to the corn in the fertile soil.
(B)The main component of desulfurized ash is gypsum, and the use of gypsum to improve saline-alkali land has a history of more than 100 years.
(C)The saline land without desulfurized ash residue is covered with dust on the 40-mu test field, and weeds are rare.
(D)The contents of heavy metals and pollutants in these desulfurized ash residues have not exceeded national standards.

response_pairs.cot_response:
Sure, let's break it down step by step:

1. The scientists applied desulfurized ash residues from power plants to saline-alkali land in Inner Mongolia.
2. As a result, corn and grass have grown in this land.
3. The scientists concluded that the desulfurized ash residues can be used to transform saline-alkali land.

Now, let's evaluate each statement:

(A) The corn grown in the saline-alkali land improved with desulfurized ash has similar growth to the corn in the fertile soil.
This statement suggests that the corn grown with desulfurized ash has similar growth to corn grown in fertile soil. This supports the idea that desulfurized ash can improve the growth of crops in saline-alkali land. It provides evidence that the ash is effective in transforming the land.

(B) The main component of desulfurized ash is gypsum, and the use of gypsum to improve saline-alkali land has a history of more than 100 years.
This statement provides historical evidence of using gypsum to improve saline-alkali land. While it indirectly supports the use of desulfurized ash, it does not directly address the effectiveness of desulfurized ash residues from coal-fired power plants.

(C) The saline land without desulfurized ash residue is covered with dust on the 40-mu test field, and weeds are rare.
This statement suggests that the saline land without desulfurized ash residue is not suitable for plant growth, as it is covered with dust and weeds are rare. However, it does not directly support the effectiveness of desulfurized ash residues in transforming the land.

(D) The contents of heavy metals and pollutants in these desulfurized ash residues have not exceeded national standards.
This statement addresses the safety aspect of using desulfurized ash residues. It suggests that the ash residues do not contain excessive levels of heavy metals and pollutants, which is important for environmental and human health. However, it does not directly support the effectiveness of the ash in transforming saline-alkali land.

Based on the evaluation, statement (A) provides the most direct and relevant evidence supporting the scientist's conclusion. It directly addresses the growth of corn in the saline-alkali land improved with desulfurized ash, which supports the idea that the ash can transform the land. Therefore, statement (A) best supports the scientist's conclusion.

examples.question:
A tourist group travels to Mulan paddock.The members ride horses, archery, eat barbecue, and finally go to the shop to buy souvenirs.Known? (1) Someone bought a Mongolian knife.(2) Someone did not buy a Mongolian knife.(3) Both Mr.Zhang and Ms.Wang of the regiment bought Mongolian knives.

If only one of the above three sentences is true, which of the following must be true?

(A)Neither Mr Zhang nor Ms Wang bought Mongolian knives.
(B)Mr.Zhang bought a Mongolian knife, but Ms.Wang did not.
(C)Mr.Li of the tour group bought a Mongolian knife.
(D)Both Mr Zhang and Ms Wang bought Mongolian knives.

response_pairs.cot_response:
Sure! Let's start by analyzing each statement and its implications.

Statement 1: Someone bought a Mongolian knife.
Implication: At least one person in the tourist group bought a Mongolian knife.

Statement 2: Someone did not buy a Mongolian knife.
Implication: At least one person in the tourist group did not buy a Mongolian knife.

Statement 3: Both Mr. Zhang and Ms. Wang of the regiment bought Mongolian knives.
Implication: Mr. Zhang and Ms. Wang both bought Mongolian knives.

Now, let's evaluate the options based on the given information.

Option A: Neither Mr. Zhang nor Ms. Wang bought Mongolian knives.
This option contradicts Statement 3, which states that both Mr. Zhang and Ms. Wang bought Mongolian knives. Therefore, Option A is not consistent with the given information.

Option B: Mr. Zhang bought a Mongolian knife, but Ms. Wang did not.
This option is consistent with Statement 3, which states that both Mr. Zhang and Ms. Wang bought Mongolian knives. Therefore, Option B is not consistent with the given information.

Option C: Mr. Li of the tour group bought a Mongolian knife.
There is no information given about Mr. Li buying a Mongolian knife. Therefore, Option C is not supported by the given information.

Option D: Both Mr. Zhang and Ms. Wang bought Mongolian knives.
This option is consistent with Statement 3, which states that both Mr. Zhang and Ms. Wang bought Mongolian knives. Therefore, Option D is consistent with the given information.

Based on our analysis, the statement that must be true is Option D: Both Mr. Zhang and Ms. Wang bought Mongolian knives.

examples.question:
There are some irrationality in our legal system.In criminal law, although the motives for committing crimes are the same, the punishment for those who commit crimes is much heavier than those who attempt to commit crimes without success.However, in civil law, a person who deliberately defrauds without success is not required to pay a fine.

Which of the following statements is true and seriously weakens the views in the above discussion?

(A)People who study civil law are more likely to find work than those who study punishment, which shows that civil law is very different from criminal law.
(B)Many jailed criminals will commit other crimes once released.
(C)For this country, criminal trials pay a higher price than civil trials.
(D)The goal of criminal law is to punish criminals, while the goal of civil law is to compensate victims.

response_pairs.cot_response:
Sure, let's break it down step by step.

The argument in the discussion is that there is an irrationality in the legal system because the punishment for those who commit crimes is heavier than those who attempt to commit crimes without success, while in civil law, a person who deliberately defrauds without success is not required to pay a fine.

To weaken this argument, we need to find a statement that provides evidence or reasoning that challenges this view.

Let's analyze each statement:

(A) People who study civil law are more likely to find work than those who study punishment, which shows that civil law is very different from criminal law.

This statement does not directly address the issue of punishment or fines in criminal and civil law. It focuses on the job prospects of those studying civil law versus those studying punishment. Therefore, it does not weaken the argument.

(B) Many jailed criminals will commit other crimes once released.

This statement does not directly address the issue of punishment or fines in criminal and civil law. It focuses on the potential for recidivism among jailed criminals. Therefore, it does not weaken the argument.

(C) For this country, criminal trials pay a higher price than civil trials.

This statement suggests that criminal trials are more costly than civil trials in terms of financial resources. While it does not directly address the issue of punishment or fines, it does provide a potential reason for the difference in punishment between criminal and civil law. It weakens the argument by suggesting that the heavier punishment in criminal law may be justified by the higher costs associated with criminal trials.

(D) The goal of criminal law is to punish criminals, while the goal of civil law is to compensate victims.

This statement directly addresses the issue of punishment and fines in criminal and civil law. It suggests that the difference in punishment is based on the different goals of criminal and civil law. It weakens the argument by providing a rationale for the difference in treatment between criminal and civil cases.

Based on this analysis, statement (D) weakens the views expressed in the discussion about the irrationality in the legal system.

examples.question:
Homo erectus originated in Africa about 2 million years ago and spread to Eurasia; modern people appeared about 200,000 years ago.Both human fossils are distributed in China.For example, the "Beijing people" unearthed in the ancient stratum of Zhoukoudian, Beijing belonged to Homo erectus; the "shandingdong people" in the stratum of the previous year belonged to modern people.A study of the contemporary Chinese population found that the Y chromosome inherited from the paternal lineage originated in Africa and originated in 8.9 10,000 years to 35,000 years ago; the mitochondrial DNA inherited from the maternal line originated in Africa, with a time of origin within 100,000 years; no genetic component of H.erectus was detected

If the above statement is true, which hypothesis is best supported?

(A)The descendants of "Beijing people" may be extinct.The ancestors of Chinese contemporary people came to Asia from Africa about 100,000 years ago
(B)Chinese Homo erectus and modern people are from the African continent, and their hybrid descendants are the ancestors of contemporary Chinese
(C)The "Stop Cave Man" in Zhoukoudian, Beijing evolved from "Beijing People"
(D)Contemporary Chinese are descendants of Homo erectus that spread from Africa to Eurasia 2 million years ago

response_pairs.cot_response:
First, let's analyze the given information:

1. Homo erectus originated in Africa about 2 million years ago and spread to Eurasia.
2. Modern humans appeared about 200,000 years ago.
3. Human fossils, including Homo erectus and modern humans, have been found in China.
4. A study of the contemporary Chinese population found that the Y chromosome inherited from the paternal lineage originated in Africa between 8,900 and 35,000 years ago.
5. The mitochondrial DNA inherited from the maternal line originated in Africa within the last 100,000 years.
6. No genetic component of Homo erectus was detected in the contemporary Chinese population.

Now, let's evaluate each hypothesis in light of this information:

(A) The descendants of "Beijing people" may be extinct. The ancestors of Chinese contemporary people came to Asia from Africa about 100,000 years ago.

This hypothesis suggests that the "Beijing people" (Homo erectus) are not the ancestors of contemporary Chinese people. Instead, it proposes that the ancestors of contemporary Chinese people came to Asia from Africa about 100,000 years ago. This hypothesis is supported by the information that the Y chromosome and mitochondrial DNA of contemporary Chinese people originated in Africa within the last 100,000 years. However, it does not address the presence of Homo erectus fossils in China or the fact that modern humans appeared about 200,000 years ago. Therefore, this hypothesis is not the best-supported one.

(B) Chinese Homo erectus and modern people are from the African continent, and their hybrid descendants are the ancestors of contemporary Chinese.

This hypothesis suggests that both Homo erectus and modern humans from Africa are the ancestors of contemporary Chinese people. It is supported by the information that Homo erectus originated in Africa and spread to Eurasia, and that modern humans appeared about 200,000 years ago. However, it does not directly address the genetic evidence of the contemporary Chinese population. Therefore, while this hypothesis is plausible, it is not the best-supported one.

(C) The "Stop Cave Man" in Zhoukoudian, Beijing evolved from "Beijing People".

This hypothesis suggests that the "Stop Cave Man" in Zhoukoudian, Beijing (presumably referring to a specific group of Homo erectus fossils) evolved from the "Beijing People" (Homo erectus). However, this hypothesis does not address the presence of modern human fossils in China or the genetic evidence of the contemporary Chinese population. Therefore, it is not the best-supported

(B)The above advertisers who refused to renew their contracts have not affected the benefits after switching to other publications.

Therefore, this answer choice does not strengthen the argument.

Based on the analysis, answer choice (C) strengthens the argument that advertisers consider ethical responsibilities in addition to economic benefits.

examples.question:
Recently, the eight major ministries and commissions such as the State Administration of Press and Publication jointly announced that the "Online Game Anti-Addiction System" and the accompanying "Online Game Anti-Addiction System Real-Name Authentication Scheme" will be officially implemented this year.Hours, experience value and income will be counted as 0.The implementation of this program will effectively prevent minors from indulging in online games.

Which of the following statements, if correct, can weaken the above conclusion most effectively?

(A)Many minors only play online games occasionally.‘‘ Internet game anti-addiction system ’has no effect on them.
(B)"Online game anti-addiction system" does not work for adults, and minors may use adult identity or use some online tools to generate fake ID numbers to log in to online games.
(C)The introduction of the "Online Game Anti-Addiction System" means that minors are allowed to play online games with the permission of the competent department, so that they can go from secret to public.
(D)In addition to online games, there are stand-alone games and PS games played on TV sets.‘‘ Online game anti-addiction system ’may cause many underage players to switch to these games.

response_pairs.cot_response:
Sure, let's analyze each statement one by one:

(A) Many minors only play online games occasionally. The "Online Game Anti-Addiction System" has no effect on them.

This statement suggests that the anti-addiction system may not be necessary for minors who only play online games occasionally. However, it does not necessarily weaken the conclusion that the system will effectively prevent minors from indulging in online games. It only suggests that the system may not be applicable to all minors.

(B) "Online game anti-addiction system" does not work for adults, and minors may use adult identity or use some online tools to generate fake ID numbers to log in to online games.

This statement raises concerns about the effectiveness of the anti-addiction system for adults and the potential for minors to bypass the system using fake identities. If this is true, it weakens the conclusion that the system will effectively prevent minors from indulging in online games.

(C) The introduction of the "Online Game Anti-Addiction System" means that minors are allowed to play online games with the permission of the competent department, so that they can go from secret to public.

This statement suggests that the anti-addiction system allows minors to play online games with permission, which may actually increase their access to games. However, it does not directly weaken the conclusion that the system will prevent minors from indulging in online games. It only suggests a potential unintended consequence.

(D) In addition to online games, there are stand-alone games and PS games played on TV sets. The "Online Game Anti-Addiction System" may cause many underage players to switch to these games.

This statement suggests that the anti-addiction system may lead to a shift in underage players' preferences from online games to other types of games. While it does not directly weaken the conclusion that the system will prevent minors from indulging in online games, it suggests that the system may not fully address the issue of minors indulging in games overall.

Based on the analysis, statement (B) weakens the conclusion the most effectively by raising concerns about the effectiveness of the anti-addiction system for adults and the potential for minors to bypass the system using fake identities.

examples.question:
There are four assertions about a criminal case? (1) There is evidence that Chen Hu did not commit the crime; (2) The perpetrator is either Wang Guang, Chen Hu, or Zhu Tong; (3) There is also evidence that Wang Guang did not commit the crime; (4) The TV screen showed? At the time of the incident, Zhu Tong was in the auditorium of a football game away from the crime scene.

Which of the following is a correct description of the four assertions in the stem?

(A)It can be deduced from the above assertion? there is only one crime.
(B)At least one of the above assertions is false.
(C)From these assertions, it can be concluded that the evidence that Wang Guang did not commit the crime is false.
(D)Zhu Tong is definitely not in the audience of the football match.

response_pairs.cot_response:

Assertion 1: There is evidence that Chen Hu did not commit the crime.

This assertion states that the perpetrator of the crime must be one of these three individuals. It does not provide any information about the guilt or innocence of any specific suspect.

Assertion 3: There is also evidence that Wang Guang did not commit the crime.
This assertion suggests that there is evidence supporting Wang Guang's innocence. It does not provide any information about the guilt or innocence of the other suspects.

This assertion provides an alibi for Zhu Tong, stating that he was in the auditorium of a football game at the time of the incident. This suggests that Zhu Tong may be innocent.

Based on these assertions, we can conclude the following:

(A) It cannot be deduced from the above assertions that there is only one crime, as the number of crimes is not mentioned.

(B) It is possible that at least one of the assertions is false, as we do not have any information about the reliability or accuracy of the evidence mentioned.

(C) It cannot be concluded that the evidence supporting Wang Guang's innocence is false, as there is no contradictory evidence provided.

(D) It can be concluded that Zhu Tong is definitely not in the audience of the football match, as Assertion 4 states that he was in the auditorium of a football game at the time of the incident.

Therefore, the correct description of the four assertions in the stem is (D) Zhu Tong is definitely not in the audience of the football match.
